sen.j: 天の川（あまのがわ、あまのかわ）は、夜空を横切るように存在する雲状の光の帯である。
sen.e: The Milky Way is a nebular cluster like a shining belt crossing the night sky.
The Milky Way is a nebular cluster like a shining belt crossing the night sky.
The Milky Way is a nebular cluster like a shining belt crossing the night sky.

sen.j: 銀河。
sen.e: It is also called the Galaxy.
It is also called a Galaxy.
It is also called a Galaxy.

sen.j: 天の川の光の帯は天球を一周しており、恒星とともに日周運動を行っている。
sen.e: The shining belt of the Milky Way covers all the way of the celestial sphere, and makes diurnal motion along with the fixed stars in it.
The glittering belt of the Milky Way covers the celestial sphere, and makes diurnal motion together with the fixed stars in it.
The glittering belt of the Milky Way covers the celestial sphere, and makes diurnal motion together with the fixed stars in it.

sen.j: 天の川の実体は膨大な数の恒星の集団である。
sen.e: In substance, the Milky Way is a cluster of trillions of fixed stars.
The Milky Way is a cluster of trillions of fixed stars.
The Milky Way is a cluster of trillions of fixed stars.

sen.j: 我々の地球を含む太陽系は「天の川銀河」と呼ばれる銀河の一員であり、我々はこの銀河を内側から見ているために天の川が天球上の帯として見える。
sen.e: The solar system including our planet is a part of the Galaxy (called "the Milky Way Galaxy"), and the Milky Way looks like a belt covering the celestial sphere because we see the Galaxy from the inside.

The solar system including our planet is a part of the Galaxy (called "the Milky Way Galaxy"), and the Milky Way looks like a belt covering the celestial sphere because we see the Galaxy from the inside.

The solar system including our planet is a part of the Galaxy (called 'the Milky Way Galaxy'), and the Milky Way looks like a belt covering the celestial sphere because we see the Galaxy from the inside.
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションに変更

sen.j: 天の川銀河の中心は射手座の方向にある。
sen.e: The center of the Milky Way Galaxy is situated in the direction of the Archer.
The center of the Milky Way Galaxy is situated in the direction of the Archer.
The center of the Milky Way Galaxy is situated in the direction of the Archer.

sen.j: 「銀河」は本来天の川を指す言葉であるが、現在では一般的な天体としての銀河（galaxy）全般を表す言葉として使われている。
sen.e: "The Galaxy" means the Milky Way, while "a galaxy" is used as a term that can apply to other heavenly bodies generally.
sen.cmt: ※「天の川」を意味する「銀河」は"The Galaxy"(固有名詞）、「一般的な天体としての銀河」は"a galaxy"（普通名詞） です。 英語ではこのように明確に区別されるので、「銀河」という同じ言葉が時の経過とともに意味を変えている、という日本語での事情はあてはまりません。 それゆえ原文とその英訳では若干ニュアンスの差が生じていることをご了承いただきたいと存じます。
sen.e: "The Galaxy" means the Milky Way, while "galaxy" is a term used to apply generally to other similar heavenly bodies.
The Galaxy' means the Milky Way, while 'galaxy' is a term used to apply generally to other similar heavenly bodies.
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションに変更

sen.j: 天体としての天の川銀河を特に「銀河系」とも呼ぶ。
sen.e: The Milky Way Galaxy as a heavenly body is sometimes distinctively called "the galactic system."
The Milky Way Galaxy as a heavenly body that is sometimes distinctively called "the galactic system."
The Milky Way Galaxy as a heavenly body that is sometimes distinctively called 'the galactic system.'
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションに変更

sen.j: 英語の Milky Way （ミルキーウェイ）は文脈によって「天の川」と「銀河系」の両方を指す。
sen.e: "The Milky Way" implies "the Garaxy" or "the galactic system," depending on the context.
"The Milky Way" implies "the Garaxy" or "the galactic system," depending on the context.
"The Milky Way" implies 'the Garaxy' or 'the galactic system,' depending on the context.
sen.cmt: 一部シングルクォーテーションに変更

sen.j: 日本では、夏と冬に天の川が南北に頭の上を越える位置に来る。
sen.e: In Japan, every summer & winter the Milky Way comes just above us across the night sky from south to north.
In Japan, every summer & winter the Milky Way appears above us across the night sky from north to south.
In Japan, every summer and winter the Milky Way appears above us across the night sky from north to south.

sen.j: これをまたいで夏には夏の大三角が、冬には冬の大三角が見える。
sen.e: We can see the Summer Triangle in summer and the Winter Triangle in winter twinkle across the Milky Way.
We can see the Summer Triangle in summer and the Winter Triangle in winter twinkling across the Milky Way.
We can see the Summer Triangle in summer and the Winter Triangle in winter twinkling across the Milky Way.

sen.j: 他の星も天の川の周辺に多いので、夏と冬の夜空はにぎやかで、これに対して春と秋の夜空には目立つ星座が少ない。
sen.e: And because there also exist the other many stars around the Milky Way, the night sky in summer and winter is full of stars, but by contrast, in spring and autumn, there exist few notable constellations in the night sky.

And because there also exist many other stars around the Milky Way, the night sky in summer and winter is full of stars, in contrast, in spring and autumn, few notable constellations exist in the night sky.

And because there also exist many other stars around the Milky Way, the night sky in summer and winter is full of stars, in contrast, in spring and autumn, few notable constellations exist in the night sky.

sen.j: なお、天の川のあちこちに中州のように暗い部分があるのは、星がないのではなく、暗黒星雲があって、その向こうの星を隠しているためである。
sen.e: Incidentally, there exist some dark areas from place to place in the Milky Way like sandbanks in stream, and this is not because there is no star in the area but because the dark nebula there conceals the stars behind itself.

Incidentally, there exist some dark areas from place to place in the Milky Way like sandbanks in a stream, and this is not because there are no stars in the area, but because dark nebula conceal stars behind itself.

Incidentally, there exist some dark areas from place to place in the Milky Way like sandbanks in a stream, and this is not because there are no stars in the area, but because dark nebula conceal stars behind itself.

sen.j: ギリシャ神話での天の川のエピソードを説明する。
sen.e: The story of the Milky Way in Greek mythology is explained below:
The story of the Milky Way in Greek mythology is explained below:
The story of the Milky Way in Greek mythology is explained below:

sen.j: ゼウスは、自分とアルクメネの子のヘラクレスを不死身にするために、女神ヘラの母乳をヘラクレスに飲ませようとしていた。
sen.e: Zeus wanted to let Hercules, a son between himself and Alkmene, suck the breast of his divine wife Hera in order to make Hercules immortal;
Zeus wanted to let Hercules, a son between himself and Alkmene, suck the breast of his divine wife Hera in order to make Hercules immortal;
Zeus wanted to let Hercules, a son between himself and Alkmene, suck the breast of his divine wife Hera in order to make Hercules immortal.
sen.cmt: セミコロン→ピリオドに変更

sen.j: しかし、嫉妬深いヘラはヘラクレスを憎んでいたため母乳を飲ませようとはしなかった。
sen.e: but jealous Hera hated Hercules, so she would never give a suck;
but jealous Hera hated Hercules, so she would never let him suck her breast;
But jealous Hera hated Hercules, so she would never let him suck her breast.
sen.cmt: 文頭の頭文字を大文字に修正、セミコロン→ピリオドに変更

sen.j: 一計を案じたゼウスはヘラに眠り薬を飲ませ、ヘラが眠っているあいだにヘラクレスに母乳を飲ませた。
sen.e: so Zeus thought out and implemented a plan that he got Hera to take a sleeping pill and that he let Hercules suck her breast while she was asleep;
so Zeus thought out and implemented a plan and he got Hera to take a sleeping pill and that allowed Hercules suck her breast while she was asleep;
So Zeus thought out and implemented a plan and he got Hera to take a sleeping pill and that allowed Hercules suck her breast while she was asleep.
sen.cmt: 文頭の頭文字を大文字に修正、余分なスペース消去、セミコロン→ピリオドに変更

sen.j: この時、ヘラが目覚め、ヘラクレスが自分の乳を飲んでいることに驚き、払いのけた際にヘラの母乳が流れ出した。
sen.e: and then, Hera woke up and got surprised to find Hercules sucking her own breast, so she shook off Hercules, when her milk spilled;
and then, Hera woke up and was surprised to find Hercules sucking her own breast, so she shook off Hercules, and her milk spilled;
And then, Hera woke up and was surprised to find Hercules sucking her own breast, so she shook off Hercules, and her milk spilled.
sen.cmt: 文頭の頭文字を大文字に修正、余分なスペース消去、セミコロン→ピリオドに変更

sen.j: これが天の川になったとされる。
sen.e: and this milk became the Milky Way, they say;
and this milk became the Milky Way, they say;
And this milk became the Milky Way, they say.
sen.cmt: 文頭の頭文字を大文字に修正、セミコロン→ピリオドに変更

sen.j: 英語での名称 Milky Way はこの神話にちなむ。
sen.e: the nebular cluster was named the Milky Way after this myth.
the nebular cluster was named Milky Way after this myth.
The nebular cluster was named Milky Way after this myth.
sen.cmt: 文頭の頭文字を大文字に修正

sen.j: 中国・日本など東アジア地域に伝わる七夕伝説では、織女星（こと座のベガ）と牽牛星（わし座のアルタイル）を隔てて会えなくしている川が天の川である。
sen.e: The legend of the Tanabata Festival, which has been handed down in East Asia, such as Japan and China, says it is the Milky Way that separates the Weaver Star (the Lyre's Vega) and the Cowherd Star (the Eagle's Altair).
The legend of the Tanabata Festival, handed down in East Asia in Japan and China, says it is the Milky Way that separates the Weaver Star (the Lyre's Vega) and the Cowherd Star (the Eagle's Altair).
The legend of the Tanabata Festival, handed down in East Asia in Japan and China, says it is the Milky Way that separates the Weaver Star (the Lyre's Vega) and the Cowherd Star (the Eagle's Altair).

sen.j: 二人は互いに恋しあっていたが、天帝に見咎められ、年に一度、7月7日の日のみ、天の川を渡って会うことになった。
sen.e: They were in love with each other, but God found fault with them, so thereafter they got to meet only once in a year on July 7, crossing the Milky Way.
They were in love with each other, but God found fault with them, so thereafter they got to meet only once a year on July 7, crossing the Milky Way.
They were in love with each other, but God found fault with them, so thereafter they got to meet only once a year on July 7, crossing the Milky Way.

sen.j: 詳細は七夕の項目を参照のこと。
sen.e: For details, please refer to the article of "Tanabata."
For details, please refer to the article "Tanabata."
For details, please refer to the article "Tanabata."

tit.e: Stories and events about the Milky Way
Stories and events about the Milky Way
Stories and Events about the Milky Way
tit.cmt: 頭文字を大文字に変更

sen.j: 『西遊記』の猪八戒は、玉帝より天蓬元帥職を任され、天の川の管理をしていた。
sen.e: In "Saiyuki" (Journey to the West), Jade Emperor appointed "Cho Hakkai" to Marshal of Heaven, who took control of the Milky Way.
In "Saiyuki" (Journey to the West), Jade Emperor appointed "Cho Hakkai" to Marshal of Heaven, who took control of the Milky Way.
In "Journey to the West," Jade Emperor appointed Zhu Bajie (Pigsy) to Marshal of Heaven, who took control of the Milky Way.
sen.cmt: 日本語読みのため、"Saiyuki"→"Journey to the West"、"Cho Hakkai"→"Zhu Bajie (Pigsy)"とし、クォーテーション削除 (参照: http://books.google.co.jp/books?id=yTbYprBUINgC&pg=PA336&dq=%22Journey+to+the+West%22+Zhu+Bajie&lr=&as_brr=3&cd=7#v=onepage&q=%22Journey%20to%20the%20West%22%20Zhu%20Bajie&f=false)

sen.j: 『万葉集』では、大伴家持の歌に、天漢（あまのがわ）とも記されている。
sen.e: In "Manyoshu" (Collection of Ten Thousand Leaves), there exists a Japanese poem composed by "OTOMO no Yakamochi" about the Milky Way, and he wrote the Milky Way in the Chinese characters of "天漢," which reads "Amanogawa" in Japanese.

In the "Manyoshu" (Collection of Ten Thousand Leaves), there exists a Japanese poem composed by "OTOMO no Yakamochi" about the Milky Way, and he wrote about the Milky Way in the Chinese characters "天漢," which reads "Amanogawa" in Japanese.

In the "Manyoshu" (Collection of Ten Thousand Leaves), there exists a Japanese poem composed by OTOMO no Yakamochi about the Milky Way, and he wrote about the Milky Way in the Chinese characters "天漢," which reads "Amanogawa" in Japanese.
sen.cmt: "OTOMO no Yakamochi"のクォーテーション削除

sen.j: 岡山県美作市では、「天の川火祭り」が、毎年開催される。
sen.e: In Mimasaka City, Okayama Prefecture, "the Milky Way Fire Festival" is held every summer.
In Mimasaka City, Okayama Prefecture, "the Milky Way Fire Festival" is held every summer.
In Mimasaka City, Okayama Prefecture, 'the Milky Way Fire Festival' is held every summer.
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションに変更

sen.j: 迫力の手筒花火、優雅な天文字焼きが行われる。
sen.e: In the festival, you can see powerful arm-held fireworks & the elegant ceremonial fires lit on the surface of a mountain in the shape of the Chinese character of "天" - this reads "ten" in Japanese - which means "Heaven."

In the festival, you can see powerful arm-held fireworks & the elegant ceremonial fires lit on the surface of a mountain in the shape of the Chinese character of "天" - this reads "ten" in Japanese - which means "Heaven."

In the festival, you can see powerful arm-held fireworks and the elegant ceremonial fires lit on the surface of a mountain in the shape of the Chinese character of "天" - this reads "ten" in Japanese - which means "Heaven."

tit.e: How to watch the Milky Way
How to watch the Milky Way
How to Watch the Milky Way
tit.cmt: 頭文字を大文字に変更

sen.j: 天の川の光は淡いため、月明かりや、人工光による光害の影響がある場合は確認が難しい。
sen.e: The light of the Milky Way is so faint that you will have difficulty finding it out, if the light is affected by the moonlight or the light pollution of artificial lights.
The light of the Milky Way is so faint that you will have difficulty finding it, if the light is affected by the moonlight or the light pollution of artificial lights from the ground.
The light of the Milky Way is so faint that you will have difficulty finding it, if the light is affected by the moonlight or the light pollution of artificial lights from the ground.

sen.j: 日本では、1970年代以降（高度成長期の終了以降）、天の川を見ることができる場所は少なくなってしまった。
sen.e: In Japan, from 1970s, that is, after the period of high economic growth, the places the Milky Way could be seen became few.
In Japan, from the 1970s, after a period of high economic growth, places ehrtr the Milky Way could be seen became few.
In Japan, from the 1970s, after a period of high economic growth, places where the Milky Way could be seen became few.

sen.j: 天の川を見るには、月明かりの無い晴れた夜に、都市から離れたなるべく標高の高い場所に行くと良い。
sen.e: To watch the Milky Way, you should look for the clear sky at moonless night at a place - of an altitude as high as possible - that is far from an urban area.
To watch the Milky Way, you should look for the clear sky on a moonless night from an altitude as high as possible ar from urban areas.
To watch the Milky Way, you should look for the clear sky on a moonless night from an altitude as high as possible ar from urban areas.

sen.j: 詳しくは、天体観望の項目を参照のこと。
sen.e: For details, please refer to the article of "Astronomical observation."
For details, please refer to the article on "Astronomical observation."
For details, please refer to the article on "Astronomical observation."

sen.j: 天の川は一年中見ることができるが、天の川銀河の中心方向が夏の星座であるいて座にあるため、夏の天の川は比較的光が強く確認し易い。
sen.e: You can watch the Milky Way throughout the year, and the light of the Milky Way in summer is relatively strong for you to find out, since the center of the Milky Way is situated in the direction of the Archer, a summer constellation.

You can see the Milky Way throughout the year, and the light of the Milky Way in summer is relatively strong and easy for you to find out, since the center of the Milky Way is situated in the direction of the Archer, a summer constellation.

You can see the Milky Way throughout the year, and the light of the Milky Way in summer is relatively strong and easy for you to find out, since the center of the Milky Way is situated in the direction of the Archer, a summer constellation.

sen.j: 逆に、冬の天の川は淡く確認が難しい。
sen.e: On the contrary, the light of the Milky Way in winter is so faint that you will have difficulty finding it out.
To the contrary, the light of the Milky Way in winter is so faint that you will have difficulty finding it.
To the contrary, the light of the Milky Way in winter is so faint that you will have difficulty finding it.
